    • addUser

      public int addUser​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String password2, java.lang.String role) throws java.sql.SQLException, BadConfirmPasswordException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Creates a new user
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the user
      password - The password of the user
      password2 - The second password to confirm they are the same
      role - The role of the user
      Returns:
      the ID of the user
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error in a SQL statement
      BadConfirmPasswordException - the passwords were not the same exception
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if an unsupported encoding method is encountered
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if no algorithm exists

    • getUsers

      Returns:

      Changes the name of a user.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the user
      name - The new name
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error in a SQL statement

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String password2) throws java.sql.SQLException, BadConfirmPasswordException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Changes the password of the user.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the user
      password - The new password of the user
      password2 - Another password for confirmation
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error in a SQL statement
      BadConfirmPasswordException - the passwords were not the same exception
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if an unsupported encoding method is encountered
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if no algorithm exists

    • changeEnabled

      public void changeEnabled​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String enabled) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Change the enabled status of a user.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the user
      enabled - Whether the user should be enabled or disabled
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error in a SQL statement
